body:
I realised it's banned on OCN, and after asking and getting some answers, I'm still confused.
It gives you an advantage, but I don't really get what.
So if someone could help answer this with some evidence that would be cool.

title: How does Toggle sprint work?

replies.body:
Toggle sprint allows you to bind a key also that when you press it you'll start sprinting. As the name suggests you can toggle it on or off when you want to sprint or walk.

Considering vanilla Minecraft basically has this feature (not the exact feature, but something similar with its sprint key) I don't understand why OCN bars it, perhaps that's something you should ask their support team about.
replies.body_tagged:
Toggle sprint allows you to bind a key also that when you press it you'll start sprinting. As the name suggests you can toggle it on or off when you want to sprint or walk.

Considering vanilla Minecraft basically has this feature (not the exact feature, but something similar with its sprint key) I don't understand why OCN bars it, perhaps that's something you should ask their support team about.

replies.body: Actually, it's a client that makes you sprint without double pressing w or pressing w with sprint button that you set. It's allowed on Avicus, but I don't know how it works on OCN. But anyway, I don't think that it's an advantage. That's why I don't have that client. But if you play MC only for PvP, that's a great idea tbh.
replies.body_tagged: Actually, it's a client that makes you sprint without double pressing w or pressing w with sprint button that you set. It's allowed on Avicus, but I don't know how it works on OCN. But anyway, I don't think that it's an advantage. That's why I don't have that client. But if you play MC only for PvP, that's a great idea tbh.

1. It takes less effort

replies.body:
I think it's less the sprint factor and more the togglesneak, as this gives a significant advantage and if you are allowed to have a togglesprint yet not a togglesneak when they are in the same mod it's still going to lead to a higher number of people togglesneaking if you get what i mean. 

By banning togglesprint it gives significantly less togglesneak users as players are less likely to use the mod.
I think it's a perfectly reasonable ban to be quite honest.

replies.body:
You are allowed to toggle sneak for say bridging however you cannot go into the GUI whilst sneaking. For example, if somebody was mining to the core and he was not found and he was sorting his inventory whilst sneaking that's impossible to do in vanilla Minecraft because you have to press your inventory button rather than the shift button.

basically what tazz did in avicus tourney 1 if that helps :)
replies.body_tagged:

For example, if somebody was mining to the core and he was not found and he was sorting his inventory whilst sneaking that's impossible to do in vanilla Minecraft because you have to press your inventory button rather than the shift button.

basically what tazz did in avicus tourney 1 if that helps :)

replies.body: The actual HCF mod has BetterSprint and ToggleSneak - ToggleSneak where you can sneak at all times. However, BetterSprint (the mod) means you can only sneak when you can in Vanilla minecraft.
replies.body_tagged: The actual HCF mod has BetterSprint and ToggleSneak - ToggleSneak where you can sneak at all times. However, BetterSprint (the mod) means you can only sneak when you can in Vanilla minecraft.

replies.body:
I've heard it gives you better know and makes it easier to combo but I doubt it's true.

Really, the only "unfair advantage" is the extra finger you get. Doesn't really make much of a difference but at the end holding a key for sprint is annoying, hence the ToggleSprint mod.
